required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient-centered Communication About Healthy Weight in Early Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Clinic-based "Patient-Centered Communication About Healthy Weight" (PCC-HW) in a Diverse Sample of Women With Early Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Comorbidities in breast cancer survival account for 49% of overall survival difference between black and white women. Many obesity-related comorbidities disproportionately affect black women, therefore pointing to a need to address obesity related comorbidities in survival disparities in early breast cancer patients. This study tinvestigates how messages and messaging about healthy weight can be tailored for racially diverse breast cancer survivors with obesity in order to ensure that clinic-based communications between patients and their oncology provider are patient-centered and culturally sensitive.

detailed_description.textblock:
The overall goal of this research is to collect essential input for the future development of a quality improvement intervention to foster "Patient-Center Communication about Healthy Weigh in clinical practice
Primary Objective:
1. Understand patient-centered perspectives on health weight communication with oncology clinicians by conducting focus groups
Secondary Objective
2. Understand oncology clinician perspectives on patient center communications for healthy weight interactions through semi-structured interviews.

primary_outcome.measure: Feedback from patients regarding healthy weight communication through focus groups
primary_outcome.description: Summary of conversation based on 5A's Behavioral Change Model

secondary_outcome.measure: Feedback from oncology providers regarding healthy weight communication through semi-structured interview
secondary_outcome.description: Provider suggestions on how to implement 5A's Behavioral change model into patient care

arm_group.description: Early breast cancer patients (Stage I-III) who have completed primary treatment with a current Body mass index (BMI) over 30.
Oncology providers associated with community-based practices

intervention.description: Breast cancer patients and oncology clinicians will participate in separate focus groups discussing patient-centered communication about healthy weight.

study_pop.textblock: Breast Cancer patients and Breast oncology providers will be eligible for this study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for Breast Cancer Cohort:
- Age 21 or older
- Diagnosed with early breast cancer, Stages I-III
- Completed primary treatment (Surgery, chemotherapy, radiation) within past 2 years
- Body mass Index of equal or greater than 30
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cannot understand and speak English
INclusion Criteria for Oncology provider cohort:
- Breast cancer oncology provider in North Carolina with MD/DO/PA/NP/RN
- associated with community-based practices

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
